choices.C: They are packages of functionality intended to meet the business needs across the organiza-tion
choices.B: They should have stable, published interfaces that allow other building block to interoperate with them
choices.A: They should not be reused in other enterprise architecture projects

questions.question_text: Which one of the following statements about TOGAF Building Blocks is NOT true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
blocks have generic characteristics as follows:
* A building block is a package of functionality defined to meet the business needs across an organization.
* A building block has published interfaces to access the functionality.
* A building block may interoperate with other, inter-dependent, building blocks.
* A good building block has the following characteristics:
 * It considers implementation and usage, and evolves to exploit technology and standards.
 * It may be assembled from other building blocks.
 * It may be a subassembly of other building blocks.
 * Ideally a building block is re-usable and replaceable, and well. specified.
* A building block may have multiple implementations but with different inter-dependent building blocks.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf8-doc/arch/chap32.html

questions.question_text:
Which pair of the following responses best completes the sentence? Architecture building blocks
____, whereas Solution Building blocks ____

choices.D: define the architecture; provide the existing legacy system
choices.E: define functionality; define the implementation of functionality
choices.B: are single function components; are groups of architecture building blocks
choices.A: are assembled; are single function components

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
33.2.3 Architecture Building Blocks

33.2.3.2 Specification Content
ABB specifications include the following as a minimum:
* Fundamental functionality and attributes: semantic, unambiguous, including security capability and manageability

33.2.4 Solution Building Blocks

33.2.4.1 Characteristics
SBBs:
* Define what products and components will implement the functionality
* Define the implementation

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap33.html

choices.B: A description to allow measurement of the compliance of the implementation
choices.D: A document that triggers the start of an architecture development cycle
choices.E: A set of general rules and guidelines
choices.C: A description to communicate the intent of the architect
choices.A: An agreement between development partners and sponsors on the deliverables

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
36.2.3 Architecture Definition Document

Purpose

The Architecture Definition Document provides a qualitative view of the solution and aims to communicate the intent of the architects.


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap36.html#:~:text=The%20Architecture%20Definition%20Document%20is,and%20for%20important%20related%20information.&text=The%20Architecture%20Definition%20Document%20provides,the%20intent%20of%20the%20architects.

Selected Answer: C
...the intent of the architect

The Architecture Definition Document is a companion to the Architecture Requirements
Specification, with a complementary objective:
■ The Architecture Definition Document provides a qualitative view of the solution and
aims to communicate the intent of the architects
■ The Architecture Requirements Specification provides a quantitative view of the solution,
stating measurable criteria that must be met during the implementation of the architecture

questions.question_text: According to TOGAF, which of the following best describes the purpose of the Architecture Definition Document?

choices.A: Any collection of organizations that has a common set of goals
choices.D: Any organization whose stock is traded
choices.B: Any corporation with more than 10,000 employees
choices.E: Any set of organizations based at the same geographic location

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes how TOGAF defines an enterprise?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
What is An "Enterprise"?

A good definition of "enterprise" is any collection of organizations that has a common set of goals and/or a single bottom line. 

http://www.opengroup.org/public/arch/p1/enterprise.htm

Selected Answer: A
A. Any collection of organizations that has a common set of goals

Selected Answer: A
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap01.html 
What is an enterprise?
The TOGAF standard considers an "enterprise" to be any collection of organizations that have common goals.

questions.question_text: According to TOGAF, who usually initiates a Request for Architecture Work?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Request for Architecture Work
Purpose
This is a document that is sent from the sponsoring organization to the architecture organization to trigger the start of an architecture development cycle. 

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap32.html#tag_32_02_17
